page.shortlink: api client api a5 u html notation method

argument.name: html
argument.description: The HTML to use as the content for the notation.

argument.name: position
argument.description: The position of the content being notated. If an array is used the first value will be used as "left" and the second as "top".

property.name: x
property.description: The horizontal position of the notation. Anchored to the left.

property.name: left
property.description: The horizontal position of the notation. Anchored to the left.

property.name: right
property.description: The horizontal position of the notation. Anchored to the right.

property.name: y
property.description: The vertical position of the notation. Anchored to the top.

property.name: top
property.description: The vertical position of the notation. Anchored to the top.

property.name: bottom
property.description: The vertical position of the notation. Anchored to the bottom.

argument.name: settings
argument.description: The settings to use when positioning the notation.

property.name: to
property.description: The alignment of the notation relative to the passed in position. Values can be "center" (the default), "above", "below", "before", "after", "adj-above", "adj-below", "adj-before" and "adj-after". Multiple alignments can be applied by combining values using spaces (for example "above after"). The "adj" prefix will make the given alignment occur after the rotation (if any) has been applied.

property.name: rotate
property.description: The rotation in degrees (-360 to 360) to apply to the notation.

property.name: offset
property.description: The amount to offset the notation from the given position.

property.name: major
property.description: The number of pixels to offset the notation on the major axis. The major axis will be the first position (if applicable) in the "to" value.

property.name: minor
property.description: The number of pixels to offset the notation on the minor axis. The major axis will be the second position (if applicable) in the "to" value.

discussion.p: This method will take the passed in HTML and wrap it in tags that allow the HTML to be absolutely positioned over content at a given position.
